justification: The Methods section states that "subjects filled in questionnaires measuring gambling problem severity (Problem Gamblers Severity Index, PGSI)."
Participants completed the "Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, HDRS" to assess depressive symptoms before the experimental tasks.
The article notes that the "behavioral inhibition and activation system (BIS/BAS)" was assessed via the BIS/BAS questionnaire scales.
For GD patients, "gambling beliefs (Gamblers Beliefs Questionnaire, GBQ)" were collected, linking the construct of gambling beliefs to the GBQ measure.
After each decision, "subjects rated their confidence on a 7-point scale," indicating that decision confidence was measured with this rating scale.
The paper explains that "Dwell times reflect attentional focus, which we recorded..." using EyeLink eye-tracking, making dwell time an instrument for measuring visual attention.
